channel.title: EasyRSC Run Server.bat doesn't works for me
channel.description:
Can someone please help me with this? I decided to try out EasyRSC Yesterday, and it worked quite fine, just that i didn't think of compiling the server, after compiling the server though, it just stopped working, i updated the xstream core as suggested in some other topics too....
Here's the error log =---------------------------------------------------------------------------= Buildfile: build.xml
runserver: [java] java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/xmlpull/v1/XmlPullParserFactory [java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.io.xml.XppDriver.createParser(XppDri ver.java:57) [java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.io.xml.AbstractXppDriver.createReade r(AbstractXppDriver.java:54) [java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.io.xml.AbstractXppDriver.createReade r(AbstractXppDriver.java:65) [java] at com.thoughtworks.xstream.XStream.fromXML(XStream.java:921) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.util.PersistenceManager.load(Persistence Manager.java:41) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.entityhandling.EntityHandler.<clinit>(En tityHandler.java:333) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.io.WorldLoader.loadSection(WorldLoader.j ava:113) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.io.WorldLoader.loadWorld(WorldLoader.jav a:37) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.model.World.getWorld(World.java:83) [java] at org.rscdaemon.server.Server.<clinit>(Server.java:29) [java] Caused by: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: org.xmlpull.v1.XmlPullP arserFactory [java] at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) [java] at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) [java] at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) [java] at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) [java] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) [java] at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) [java] at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) [java] ... 10 more [java] Exception in thread "main" [java] Java Result: 1
BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: 0 seconds Press any key to continue........ =---------------------------------------------------------------------------=
and it just stays like this, no GUI pops out and nothing else can be done, i already tried updating JDK and JRE, and all what i have tried so far doesn't works honestly, can anyone explains me what exactly is the problem in here......?
also, im quite new to RSC Servers, that's why i decided to go with EasyRCS as a start.
also, im new to these forums, cheers. hope to get along with you all.

item.title: EasyRSC Run Server.bat doesn't works for me
item.dc:creator: @Malanqa13 Malanqa13
item.description:
@Malanqa13 wrote:

Wow, Thank you so much!
After reading your reply, i started wondering ‘‘What version of Java am i actually using… exactly…?’’
So then i decided to check out and i found out it was Java 7… it must have automatically updated or something
So i removed it and installed the Java 6 version, and now it’s working, Thank you so much, i would have never guessed it without your help.

And if anyone else out there haves this problem here’s how i solved it, give it a shot, it might help:

Basically i have Windows XP so you have to go:

Control Panel> Java *if you have it there, if not you can try it here http://www.java.com/en/download/installed.jsp *
then check the version there

If it’s showing Java 6, then i have no idea…

if it’s showing Java 7 then you have problably found your problem

Move on to Add/Remove programs and delete the update there if you can find it, or just completly wipe out Java and install Java 6

Anyways, since the problem its sort of solved for me, can anyone lock this topic, or how can i do it?

Read full topic
item.source: EasyRSC Run Server.bat doesn't works for me

item.title: EasyRSC Run Server.bat doesn't works for me

item.description:
@waj wrote:

Try java6 instead of 7

item.source: EasyRSC Run Server.bat doesn't works for me

item.title: EasyRSC Run Server.bat doesn't works for me
item.dc:creator: @Malanqa13 Malanqa13
item.description:
@Malanqa13 wrote:

Thank you for your reply,

I already tried updating the xstream core jar file as suggested in this topic you linked, however it doesn’t work still, at all… i also linked the compiler to the jdk 6 folder, however, i still have the jdk 7 inside the Java folder, would that cause trouble?..

Also i would like to add that even creating a fresh copy or downloading the server files from the main download, and running it doesn’t work anymore, so i think i might have screwed something up in the Java folder, i might check on that for a while, thanks again.

If someone else knows another solution, please reply.

Read full topic
